titles.title: O Lord! When we the path retrace

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O Lord! When we the path retrace Which Thou on earth hast trod, To men Thy wondrous love and grace, Thy faithfulness to God;

verse.name: v2
v3
verse.lines: Though Thou didst pass through woes and grief, Thy works were ever good; Although midst sorrows all Thy life, Thou spak’st no murmuring word.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Faithful amidst unfaithfulness, ’Mid darkness only light, Thou didst Thy Father’s name confess, And in His will delight;

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Unmoved by Satan’s subtle wiles, Or suffering, shame, and loss, Thy path, uncheered by earthly smiles, Led only to the cross.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: O Lord, with sorrow and with shame, We meekly would confess, How little we, who bear Thy Name, Thy mind, Thy ways express.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: We wonder at Thy lowly mind, And fain would like Thee be, And all our rest and pleasure find In learning, Lord, of Thee.
